[If any be distrest, and faine would gather] If any be distrest, and faine would gather Some comfort, let him hasten toâOvr Father, For we of helpe and hope are all bereaven, Unlesse thou succour us,âwhich art in Heaven, Thou shewest mercy there, and for the same We praise thee, singingâhallowed be thy Name: Of our distresses, Lord, cast up the summe, Shew us thy joyes, and letâthy kingdome come: We mortall are, and alter from our birth, Thou constant art;âthy will be done on earth, Thou mad'st the Earth, Skies, Stars, and Planets seven, Thy Name be blessed here,âas tis in heaven: Nothing we have wherewith our debts to pay, Unlesse thou give to us,âgive us this day Wherewith to cloath us, wherewith to be fed, For without thee we wantâour daily bread: We want, but want no sinne, for no day passes But we doe sin:âforgive us our trespasses, No man from sinne that ever free did live; Forgive us, Lord, our sinnes,âas we forgive If we repent our sinnes thou ne're disdain'st us; We pardonâthem their trespasses against us: Forgive us that is past, and new path tread us; Direct us alwayes in thy truth,âand lead us As thine owne people, and thy chosen Nation, Into all truth, butânot into temptation: Thou that of all good graces art the giver, Permit us not to wander,âbut deliver Us from th'assaults of World, of Flesh, of Devill, So shall thy mercies freeâus from all evill. To these Petitions let both Church and Lay-men With one consent of voyce and heart, sayâAmen. [Since it be fit that I account should give] Since it be fit that I account should give, What way unto SalvationâI beleeve Of my profession here the sum I gather, First I confesse a faithâin God the Father In God who without helper or partaker, Was of himselfe the WorldsâAlmighty maker And first gave time his being, who gave breath, To all the creaturesâboth of heaven and earth: Our everlasting welfare doth consist, In his great mercies,âand in Iesus Christ The second person of that three in one, The Fathers elect, andâhis onely Sonne, That ever blessed and incarnate Word, Which our Redeemer is, our life,âour Lord, For why? by Satans guile we were deceiv'd, Christ was that meanes of helpe,âwhich was conceived Yea when we were in danger to be lost, Conceived for usâby the Holy Ghost, And that we might not ever be forlorne, For our eternall safety he wasâborne Borne as a man, that man might not miscarry, Even of the substanceâof the Virgin Mary, And loe a greater mercy and a wonder, He that can make all sufferâsuffered under The Jewish spite, which all the world revil'd at, [illeg.] Romish tyrannies ofâPontius Pilate, [illeg.] him I doe beleeve who was envied, Who with extreamest hateâwas crucified, Who being life it selfe, to make assured Our soules of safety, was bothâdead and buried, And that no servile feare in us might dwell, To conquerâhe descended into hell, Where no infernall power had power to lay Command upon him, but onâthe third day The force of death and hell he did constraine, And so in Triumphâhe arose againe Yea the Almighty power advanc't his head, As well above all things asâfrom the dead, Then that from thence gifts might to men be given, With gloryâhe ascended into heaven, Where that supreame and everlasting Throne, Which was prepar'd, he climb'dâand sitteth on, That blessed seat where he shall make abode, To pleade for us atâthe right hand of God, And no where should he be enthroned rather, Then there, for he is God as isâthe Father, And therefore with an equall love delight I, To praise and serve them both as oneâAlmighty: Yet in their office there's a difference, And I beleeve that Jesus Christâfrom thence Shall in that great and universall doome, Returne, and that with Angelsâhe shall come To question such as at his Empire grudge, Even those that have presumed himâto judge And that black day shall be so Catholique, As I beleeve not only thatâthe quicke Shall to that grand Assize be summoned, But he will both adjudge themâand the dead: Moreover in the Godhead I conceive, Another Person in whomâI doe beleeve For all my hope and blessednsse were lost, If I beeleeve notâin the Holy Ghost, Although vaine Schismaticks through pride and folly Contemne her power, I doe beleeveâthe holy Chaste Spouse of Christ, for whom so many search By marks uncertaine, the trueâCatholick Church, I doe beleeve, God keepe us in this Union, That there shall be for everâthe Communion Of Gods elect, and that he still acquaints His children in the fellowshipâof Saints, Though damned be mens naturall condition, By grace in Christ I looke forâthe remission Of all my foule misdeeds, for there begins Deaths end, which is the punishmentâof sinnes, Moreover I the Sadducees infection Abhor, and doe beleeveâthe resurrection Yea though I turne to dust, yet through God I, Expect a glorious risingâof the body, And that exempted from the cares here rife, I shall enjoy perfection,âand the life That is not subject unto change or wasting, But ever blessed, and forâeverlasting. This is my joy, which that it faile not when It most should speed me, let God sayâAmen. To whom, that he so much vouchsafe me may, Thus as a member of the Church I pray. FINIS.
